title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.2 Early Child Development (ECD): CHILD PROTECTION SYSTEM

description.narrative: 1.2 By 2022, a coordinated child protection system, including alternative care system, prevents and responds to violence, abuse and neglect of children in home, care and preschool environments, which contributes to Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children under 5 in targeted areas benefit from improved access to quality healthcare and nutrition, protection and development opportunities in their home, care and preschool environments.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.2 By 2022, a coordinated child protection system, including alternative care system, prevents and responds to violence, abuse andneglect of children in home, care and preschool environments

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF developed strategic relationships with the Probation Commissioners in six of the nine provinces to begin moving from a project to a system strengthening approach. A total of 4,248 children, either victims or at risk of violence or family separation, were reached through UNICEF-supported social welfare and justice services. UNICEF also supported the finalisation of two key evidence pieces – the census report on children living in institutional settings and the functional assessment;of the Social Services;Workforce – that were launched by the Government and are informing policy implementation and programming in the sector. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:01/02/2022

title.narrative: Number of districts that implement local protocols on case management and referral for the protection of children from violence, abuse and neglect(52661), Text

target.value: 2022:15 districts will be covered in 9 provinces ( focus on expansion to all 9 Provinces )

title.narrative: An alternative care policy in line with the 2009 Guidelines for the Alternative Care of Children is available in the country (23-03-L3-01), Text

baseline.value: Score 1:Alternative care policy is not available

target.value: 2022:Score 4 : Alternative care policy and costed action plan are available and there is a budget line.

actual.value: 2021:Score 2 Alternative Care Policy is available and costed action plans developed for Eastern, Northern and Uva provinces. Discussions have started for the Central, Western and Southern provinces to begin work in 2022.

title.narrative: Data on most forms of violence, exploitation and abuse of children are collected through routine administrative sources(52660), Text

baseline.value: Score 1:Assessment Report on administrative sources of data on violence, exploitation and abuse of children is available

target.value: 2022:Score 3: National standards on data collection, reporting, and data flow processes on administrative sources of data on violence, exploitation and abuse of children is available.

actual.value: 2021:Score 1 UNICEF is working with the NCPA and Department of Probation and Child Care Services on strengthening routine administrative data on violence against children. Deep dive technical sessions with all nine provincial probation teams will be held in ea

title.narrative: A National Child Protection Strategy is available(52659), Text

baseline.value: Score 1:National Child Protection policy is not available

target.value: 2022:Score 3: Child protection policy is available and there is a costed action plan

actual.value: 2021:Score 2 5-year child protection action plan developed and approved by the NCPA board

title.narrative: Functional Social Service Workforce providing coordinated child protection and response services (69980)

baseline.value: Social Service Workforce functional in 05 GN divisions benefitting around 100 children from care and protection services

target.value: 2022:Social Service Workforce functional in 63 GN divisions benefitting around 600 children from care and protection services
